p1: I started cooking at 17 and have had the privilege of working in the best kitchens in Argentina, Chile, Peru, Spain, and the Netherlands. My experience includes Michelin-starred restaurants and some of the world's top 50, such as Disfrutar in Barcelona (World's Best Restaurant 2024), Rijks in Amsterdam, and Ambrosía in Santiago.
p2: I trained with Argentina's top chef, Javier Rodríguez, and worked in the renowned kitchen of Peruvian chef Iván Kisic.
p3: In 2019, I was the only Argentine finalist in the San Pellegrino Young Chef competition, and later became an Executive Chef at a Michelin Bib Gourmand restaurant, where I perfected my own creative culinary identity.
p_home: I bring Michelin discipline, Latin passion, and Nordic clarity to the table. A mix of precision and chaos.
img1_desc: Cod fish sous vide, seaweed emulsion, trout egg and leche de tigre nikkei
img2_desc: Dry age beef, beurre noisette, egg yolk cream, garlic capers, terragon.
img3_desc: Marinated mackerel, fig compote, pickled onion, Zafron beurre blanc
